bibl.title: Wu Kao v. Henry M. White. Return
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: The District Court of the United States, Western District of Washington, Northern Division

div1.p: In the Matter of the Application of Wu Kao (Ng Go) for a Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable Jeremiah Neterer, Judge of the above entitled court:

Comes now Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, at the port of Seattle, respondent in the above entitled proceeding, and for answer to the writ of habeas corpus herein issued and served upon this respondent, respectfully shows:

That the respondent here produces the body of the said Wu Kao (Ng Go), the person named in the petition for the said writ of habeas corpus in obedience to the command and direction of this honorable court.

And the respondent further shows to this court that the said WuKao (Ng Go), is lawfully detained in the custody of this respondent for the purpose of deportation from the United States, as an alien Chinese, who originally gained conditional entry into United States, under and by virtue of the terms and conditions of that certain bond, a copy of which is attached to the petition herein, and a copy of which is hereto attached, under and by virtue of instructions received from the Secretary of Labor, Washington, D. C., issued and directed to this respondent, numbered 54898--92, reading as follows, to-wit:
and by virtue of the original record in this case had and made under the authority of the Commissioner of Immigration, which said original record is hereto attached and made a part of this return.
WHEREFORE, Having fully answered herein, the respondent respectfully prays that the said writ may be forthwith discharged.

HENRY M. WHITE, being first duly sworn upon his oath deposes and says: That he is Commissioner of Immigration at the Port of Seattle, and is the respondent named in the above entitled action and in the foregoing return to the writ of habeas corpus; that he has read the above return; knows the contents thereof and believes the same to be in all respects true.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 19th day of November, A.D. 1920.
In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington.
In the Matter of the Application of Wu Kao (Ng Go) for a Writ of Habeas Corpus,
Filed in the United States District Court
